properties.areaDesc: Inner waters from Point Mugu to San Mateo Pt. CA including Santa Catalina and Anacapa Islands
properties.headline: Marine Weather Statement issued January 24 at 4:32PM PST by NWS Los Angeles/Oxnard CA
properties.description:
Areas of dense fog have have developed late this afternoon across
the coastal waters from the Palos Verdes peninsula southward to
Orange county and inland across the San Pedro Channel to near
Catalina Island. At 4 pm, Cabrillo Beach reported a visibility
near zero while Huntington Beach reported one-eighth mile.
The southern coastal waters will likely continue to experience
visibilities from one quarter mile to near zero at times through
early Saturday morning.

Mariners in harbor, especially those without radar, should
consider remaining in harbor until the dense fog improves.
Poor visibilities can obscure vision of exposed rocks and other
vessels, including large ships in the shipping lanes.

NWSheadline: DENSE FOG TO AFFECT SOUTHERN COASTAL WATERS THROUGH MID MORNING SATURDAY
